content: 1 © stopnhook 2024 all rights reserved this pattern is for personal use only do not copy and sell this pattern if you like to share it with someone please share the direct link to the pattern you can use this pattern to create physical items and sell those in small quantities if you are a small business but please give @stopnhook credit on social media platforms hello i am so happy that you have decided to make this collar for yourself this is a very versatile piece that if you change your yarn and colour choices you will have a collar in a different style nevertheless i hope it makes your day as it does for mine i used 5 different colours from different yarn brands this can essentially be a project to use up some scrap yarn if you wish to make this in 5 different colours then i would suggest choosing at least 1 of these colours to be a chunky size yarn 2 of these colours from aran/worsted weight yarn and 2 of them to be a light weight cotton yarn to add up in the texture of this collar if you wish to work with only one colour then of course you are free to choose whichever yarn size you like the best this pattern is written in the us crochet terms i have also added a conversion chart if you prefer to crochet this in the uk terms i would suggest reading through the pattern or taking a look at the diagram before starting to crochet this will help you with your colour choices to plan your own collar i state each colour at the end of the row but that is only for guiding purposes feel free to ignore it if you like your colours different level beginner size standard one-size materials 4 00 mm hook tapestry needle scissors - it is not essential to crochet a gauge swatch for this pattern - turning chains are included in the total number of stitches in parentheses at the end of each row - x3 in the pattern stands for the repetition of the part in parentheses for 3 times yarn information colour a colour b colour c colour d colour e style craft grace madam tricote madam tricote knitcraft by james c brett colour long paris-madame paris-madame hobbycraft join aztec aran with grass cotton cotton the dots alpaca weight aran colour 007 colour 043 colour cream shade al19 weight orange pink print weight aran weight light 3 weight light 3 weight chunky pattern row 1 start with a slipknot and chain 69 chain 2 to turn turn your work 71 colour a row 2 starting in the third chain from the hook double_crochet in next 11 chs 2 double_crochet in next chain double_crochet in next 10 chs 2 double_crochet in next chain double_crochet in next 10 chs 2 double_crochet in next chain x3 double_crochet in last 12 chs change colour chain 2 turn 73
